description.text:
The Galatia SIL fonts contain most of the symbols defined in Unicode 3.1 for Latin-1, Greek (excluding Coptic), Macintosh Character Set (US Roman), and 850WE/Latin-1 and are supplied in Regular and Bold weights.
Two fonts from this typeface family are included in this release:
* Galatia SIL Regular * Galatia SIL Bold
There are no OpenType tables in this font. Thus, there is no automatic formation of the final sigma.
More detail on the font can be seen at http://scripts.sil.org/GalatiaSIL.
ChangeLog ---------- (This should list both major and minor changes, most recent first.)
13 Jul 2009 Version 2.1 - rereleased with fixed Mac license string
12 Jun 2009 Version 2.1 OFL release of Galatia SIL. - released under OFL - 'vdmx' table recalculated because of errors in the font causing some Java[tm] applications on some Windows machines to not display glyphs in Galatia SIL
30 Jun 2005 Version 2.0.1 - 'hhea' table of the two TrueType fonts has been modified, because an error in the metrics specified there could cause some software, particularly some packages running on Linux, to crash or otherwise perform incorrectly.
5 Oct 2002 Version 2.0 - reencoded for Unicode - name changed to "Galatia SIL" to reflect new SIL font naming conventions - added: 03D7 GREEK KAI SYMBOL 03F3 GREEK LETTER YOT 03F4 GREEK CAPITAL THETA SYMBOL Combining Diacritics Latin-1 (MS Windows CP 1252) - revised: 03DD GREEK SMALL LETTER DIGAMMA Shape changed to more standard form f-like shape retained as potential presentation form 0384 GREEK TONOS Redesigned to add slight tilt toward right Old shapes not retained (note: this affects all monotonic composites) period, colon, semicolon, greek question mark all enlarged - full release (including keyboard files) is aimed at Windows users - Mac OS X users can also use the fonts, but no keyboard utility is included
1995 - SIL Galatia created - a custom-encoded font
